page.title: 07Playground Games - General.
page.content: Many children enjoy playing popular sports such as football, cricket, netball, tennis or rounders during their playtimes. However, there are other games to be seen on the playground, some traditional, and some which have come about as a result of invention or adaptation on the part of the children. Younger children (5-7 year olds) prefer games which follow a specific pattern, such as 'In and Out the Dusty Bluebells' or 'I Sent a Letter to My Friend,' whereas many of the games enjoyed by older children (8-11 year olds) involve chases and/or throwing of a ball, such as 'Offground Touch,' 'Fox and Hounds' and 'Poison Ball.' A detailed description of two games played by the children of Glanaman can be seen on{Page 8.}
